reviews.review_msg: Honestly, this was the first time I decided not to cheat at all although the course was online! She makes you invested in the course and encourages peer feedback. The TAs were helpful, too. You don't need to worry about your grade if you participate and benefit from all the resources she provides. It is a useful course.
Respectful, hardworking and resourceful. Lots of homework and helpful feedback. Clear instructions and criteria. You feel valued in her classes and can use what you learn in the future.
A bit biased, midterm average was very low 57% but willing to weigh final more. Final was very fair, gave study guide. Overall, course is interesting.

The course was meant to teach undergraduate econ majors an introduction to communicate effectively using economics lingo, but she made it about something else completely. She had biases towards certain students, which became evident towards the end of the course. Do not recomend taking any course with her.
Talks way too much and always makes simple content more difficult.
Without any useful helping on the course, the test is not related to what she taught during the class. Awful professor.
